bullets.text: Fed reappoints all regional bank presidents, signaling policy continuity as markets weigh 2025 rate cuts.
Fed terminates enforcement actions with Credit Suisse entities and JPMorgan, easing regulatory overhang for global banks.
S&P 500 hits record; small caps surge in early 'January effect' as Asia-Pacific equities follow overnight gains.
U.S. home prices turn negative for first time in 2+ years as falling mortgage rates revive demand, affordability still constrained.
Broadcom beats; guides AI chip sales to double this quarter, underscoring resilient datacenter demand.
Oracle shares sink on AI infrastructure spend concerns, dragging peers, despite 150% jump in lease commitments to meet AI demand.
Potential systematic overcounting in payrolls could strengthen the case for additional Fed rate cuts in 2025.
White House orders a single national AI regulatory standard, preempting state rules and centralizing oversight.
OpenAI launches GPT-5.2, claiming stronger professional task performance as it counters Google's advances.
Disney partners with OpenAI to let Sora generate videos featuring Disney characters, alongside a $1B investment.
U.S. tightens Venezuela sanctions, targets Maduro’s family and oil sector; seizes 'spoof' tanker, signaling readiness for further interdictions.
Zelensky says revised U.S. plan still envisions Ukraine ceding Donbas, raising stakes for European security and negotiations.
Federal judge blocks FEMA from canceling climate resiliency grants as administration delays broader disaster-policy overhaul.
Bessent proposes overhauling a crisis-era financial regulator to streamline rules and jumpstart growth.
Scientists identify a massive CO2 reservoir beneath the seafloor, potentially revising carbon cycle estimates and climate models.
